tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: I want to express my heartfelt gratitude to Dr. Vanitha Vaishnav for her exceptional care during every step of my pregnancy journey. Dr. Vaishnav's expertise in diagnosis, coupled with her unwavering support, made the entire experience incredibly positive.What sets Dr. Vaishnav apart is not just her medical proficiency but also her genuine kindness and availability. She went above and beyond, making herself accessible through calls and WhatsApp, ensuring that I felt supported and informed at all times.Her practical approach to consultations was truly reassuring, providing clear explanations and guidance. Dr. Vaishnav's commitment to patient well-being is evident in every aspect of her practice.I wholeheartedly recommend Dr. Vanitha Vaishnav to anyone seeking not only a skilled medical professional but also a compassionate and dedicated partner throughout their pregnancy. Grateful for the excellent care! #ExceptionalDoctor #Gratitude #PregnancyJourney

tags: Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
so me and husband wanted to do a MTP as we were not ready for the child. and we were wanting the best doctor for us as we did not want any complications in the future. so we found dr Vanita Vaishnav and checked the reviews and thought she would be the best pic.(not knowing what was awaiting us)
we went there and discussed, so she was very polite and asked us to get my blood tests and ultrasound done so that she could proceed further. and asked us to send the reports on whatsapp and called us at Apollo clinic(HSR layout). she told us about the whole procedure and asked us to pay while she gave the MTP kit to me. okay first of all the amount we paid for half an hour of her precious time, a MTP Kit for 300-400rs and an after MTP ultrasound (1500 Generally anywhere) was hefty(8.3k).but we didn't flinch at all thinking that she would be there guiding us about the complications and depression MTP could bring. And also the guidance on contraceptives methods were also a part of the procedure.
so she asked us to come back and take an ultrasound after a week or so of the procedure at Apollo only. we went there on time only to find out she wasn't there and probably was on vacation. we still didn't mind and had a call with her. the way she talked was not the same as she was talking before the amount was paid( actually we told, we were leaving the city soon, so would be better if she can meet or guide us further on contraception, she replied- just because u are leaving the city does not change my procedure). after the call, we went and asked the receptionist about the ultrasound. ohh God, the service that clinic provides is very bad, nobody pays attention to the patients, faced total ignorance from the entire team and the guy who was to do the ultrasound. after a long verbal spat, they kind of sent us to some other diagnostic centre. things at that diagnostic centre were fine.
so after the ultrasound and after few days, i was facing some serious depression, which i wanted to discuss with the doctor and thought may be she could give some input , but there wasn't any reply. i ignored and went on to ask about the contraceptive methods which she told she would definitely help with as its part of the procedure. messages were getting read , but i never got a single reply from her.
but the same doc until payment was done was replying to me normally. * ***** **** **** **** *** * *** **** **** ******* ***** **** ****** * *** *** *** **** * ********* ***** **** **** *** **** *** ********
reply_text:
1. MTP is a medico-legal procedure. Has to be done at registered place by the registered doctor. 

2. I gave ypu an option of Apollo as it is registered for MTP , plus it was meeting your requirements of having everything( consult and scan) at the same place. 

3. I had given you a very clear picture of the MTP package, with inclusions and exclusions.  It's pre decided by the clinic. Doctors don't interfere and don't don't have any say in it. 

4. Every absence from the clinic doesn't mean vacation. It can be emergencies( personal or professional). And like you said you had travel plan, doctors also have their plans and holidays. And as I said to you- I wouldnt prefer to change my clinical guidelines and procedure methods based on patients personal  issues. If your yravel plan was more important than the MTP, you are free to decide accordingly. 

5. I share my number for Real emergencies and sharing reports. I prefer in person discussion for other queries. 

6. I gave you the contraceptive advise. You were always free to ask more if it wasn't clear or you wanted other advise. 

7. Depression - happened a month later  after your MTP.  Treating depression isn't my clinical qualification... And replying to such messages also isn't medicolegally advised for us. There can be various reasons for depression. Would suggest you to meet a clinician for the same. 

8. Feel free to go to a pharmacy and take the treatment . I gave you options, and you chose doctor and clinic. 

I hope all your queries are answered. 

Wish you safery and good health.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
context: General Medical Consultation,Pregnancy Check Up,Obstetrics / Antenatal Care,
review:
Our All-star Doctor right from planning to delivery :)
When me and my wife decided to dwell into the beautiful world of parenthood, we were faced with lot of perplexity. We consulted multiple Gynecologists and almost of them recommended things which seemed more complicated.
Dr. Vanita came to our lives as a blessing when we needed the most. Her calm yet stern way of advising the right consulting helped us in our beautiful endeavor.  From the joyous morning when we got the news of pregnancy to the day when our bub arrived, Dr. has always been the mentor beyond her professional duty. As the EOD arrived, clear expectations were relayed and this helped us make the decision. Both as a gynecologist and obstetrician, Dr. Vanita is the best in the city and we highly recommend.
My wife found solace in her guidance and we are forever grateful. 
Regards,
Vishal and Deepali
reply_text:
Thank you Deepali  and Vishal .

Take care.

tags: None
review:
We were planning for pregnancy when we consulted Dr. Vanita. 
The approach doctor took from the start of consultation was very detailed and she took time to understand issues and counsel us. I did not feel the need to discuss issues with anyone else as Dr ensured I'm adequetly informed about the stages of pregnancy, required tests, precautions, medicines etc. 
I had a very good experience for my complete consultation process, amd would recommed Dr Vanita to patients who need to discuss and understand their problems and the right treatment.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Had visited Dr Vanita for issues with getting pregnant with pcod. she explained the whole step by step treatment procedure and always answered all our queries. she also encouraged us to ask questions and explained every procedure very well. I conceived with her treatment and my pregnancy journey went very smoothly with her guidance. she always responded to my queries on WhatsApp as well during consultation. During my labour she continuously followed up with us and the hospital and it went well. I'm really thankful to her for making this journey so beautiful and I would definitely recommend her for all gynac related issues as she listens to your problems and provides good treatment

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: High-Risk Pregnancy Care,Pregnancy Hypertension (Preeclampsia/ Eclampsia),Pre and Post Delivery Care,
review: In the 4th month of pregnancy, we discovered that it is a high risk pregnancy(pregnancy induced hypertension) and Dr. Vanita carefully charted the treatment course. It was also complicated by the fact that we contracted covid in the 4th month. Through regular follow ups and continuous guidance, Dr Vanita ensured that all our concerns were addressed and the pregnancy went on smoothly. She was always reachable and would respond to our calls/messages immediately. In the end, our child had to be delivered at 35 weeks and she helped deliver the child successfully. We are very greatful to Dr. Vanita and highly recommend her to anyone looking for a good obstetrician.
reply_text:
Thank you for the kind words. 
Stay safe and take care :)

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: I visited for my 1st pregnancy from start till delivery and all i can say is She is just too good.. i would like to recommend her to each and every lady. from the beginning till the end she supported me all the way she can.. she is very friendly, she will listen to your problem carefully and she explains all the issues so well even a layman can understand. She is very professional and will share each and every detail with you.. "Thank you" will be an understatement what she has done.. But surely i can you won't regret if you visit her..
reply_text:
Thank you for the kind words. :) 
Enjoy motherhood.... Stay safe !

context: family planning and full contraceptive services,
review:
We went to doctor for contraceptive and general health advice for my wife. The doctor was really good and very patient and threw light on the important things we need to be aware of. We have circulated through a few doctors and found Dr Vanita to be the best. 
We were not very impressed with the reception though. Found some of the ladies siting there severely disorganised. We needed to know our number and for some reason the reception wouldn‚Äôt reveal that. We asked multiple times and every time they would say - ‚Äúlet me come back. Please wait‚Äù. And there was never a come back.

They said they will conduct another - I let them keep the money rather than put myself at risk again. Suggest avoid both.
